poem:
Title: "In the Cool Morning Shadow of Number Ten"

In the tea-stained headlines, a dance of digits appears,
600,000 inked shadows of children, hidden in gears.
Promises dangle like quotidians on the cobwebs of time,
The choir of the innocent hums in poverty's grime.
Ah, the government waltzes, in muted pantomime,
While deepening trenches of 'could be', whisper in rhyme.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "No 10 says it will consider Waspi report but does not commit to paying compensation – UK politics live 12.56pm GMT Number of children living in 'deep poverty' up by 600,000 since 2010, DWP figures show The Child Poverty Action Group has issued its anaysis of and reaction to the DWP poverty figures out today. (See 10.39am.) Like Save the Children, CPAG reckons the key statistic is the one showing the number of children living". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
